item.title: Report E-2025040107
item.description:
Report E-2025040107

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-04
  • City: GARLAND
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 14500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a punctured leaking poly tote containing hazardous product, Barquat MB-50. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 140-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor, the concrete beneath the trailer, the asphalt parking lot, and the soil. The trailer floor was impacted in a 20’ x 8.5’ area and the concrete beneath the trailer, asphalt, and soil were impacted in a 100’ x 75’ area. The contractor neutralized the release and applied oil dry. A vac truck extracted approximately 2,700-gallons of impacted rainwater and containerized it into one vac box. Three 55-gallon DF’s containing the cut-up tote, impacted oil dry, and impacted PPE were also generated. ERTS will coordinate disposal of the vac box. XPO will manage the drum waste created from the response. No storm-drains or waterways were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2025040125
item.description:
Report E-2025040125

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-04
  • City: LAREDO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 4, 2025, two (2) 3-liter pails of paint were crushed and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to cardboard. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 Environmental (E3) to remediate the site. The crew placed the damaged pails in one (1) 5-gallon pail. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect the spent material and all impacted materials in one (1) additional 5-gallon pail.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO METRO 4 FOR A SPILL. UPON ARRIVING IN FULL P.P.E., THE RESPONDER DISCOVERED A HAZMAT PACKAGE, LEAKING ON AN IRREG TABLE. IT WAS RELATED TO THE RESPONDER THAT IT HAD PREVIOUSLY BEEN ON IT SIDE. HE CONTAINERIZED THE SPILL AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE DMP CAGE FOR PROCESSING.

  • Description: NATX 35812 was overloaded with liquid Propane this causing the PRD to vent releasing liquid Propane. A load reduction of 4525 gallons to reduce to 19" of outage and 160.0 PSI was done to stop the release of product. Shipper Phoenix Park Energy provided a 331 LPG Transport for the reduction.

item.description:

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 31, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of product was punctured and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the dock floor. All impacted materials and the damaged pail were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for future disposal.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0

  • Description: AT APPROXIMATELY 7:30 AM, THE RESPONDER RECIEVED A CALL FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE THAT WAS ON METRO 3. THE RESPONDER ARRIVED IN FULL PPE TO FIND A BOX THAT WAS WET. FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE, THE RESPONDER ULTIMATELY CONTAINERIZED THE SPILL AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE DMP CAGE FOR PROCESSING.
